    • Constructor Detail

      • JdbcObjectModel

        public JdbcObjectModel(za.co.neilson.sqlite.orm.DatabaseModel<java.sql.ResultSet,java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> databaseModel)
                throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                       java.lang.NoSuchFieldException

        The ObjectModel constructor initializes the ObjectModelColumns included in the Model.

        By default this is done using reflection to inspect the class that the model represents, and creating a column for each property.

        Override the ObjectModel.onInitializeObjectModelColumns() for finer control over which properties are persisted and how.

        Parameters:
        databaseModel2 -
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Since:
        0.1

    • Method Detail

      • setColumnValues

        protected java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> setColumnValues(java.lang.Object t,
                                                                   za.co.neilson.sqlite.orm.ObjectModel.QueryType queryType)

        Binds the state of the object's properties to the columns in which they will be persisted.

        If the ObjectModel's ObjectModelColumns were automatically generated, i.e. onInitializeObjectModelColumns() was not overridden, the database table's column names will exactly match. the names of the object's properties.

        Reflection is used to get the value of the property with the same name as the database table column, and insert it into the Map with the column name as the Map key for use in database operations.

        Override the ObjectModel.getColumnValues() method for finer control over the way that an object's properties are persisted in the database table.

        Specified by:
        setColumnValues in class za.co.neilson.sqlite.orm.ObjectModel<T,java.sql.ResultSet,java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>>
        Parameters:
        t - the Object whose properties must be transformed into the HashMap<columnName, columnValue> form by this method
        queryType - the type of database query that is going to be performed using these columns and values
        Returns:
        HashMap<String, Object>
        Since:
        0.1

      • getColumnValue

        protected java.lang.Object getColumnValue(java.sql.ResultSet resultSet,
                              za.co.neilson.sqlite.orm.ObjectModelColumn objectModelColumn,
                              int resultSetObjectModelColumnIndex)
                                   throws java.lang.NoSuchFieldException,
                                          java.lang.SecurityException,
                                          java.sql.SQLException

        Gets the value of the field represented by the ObjectModelColumn supplied from the ResultSet returned by a database query. The value is applied to the corresponding field of an instance of the object managed by this object model.

        Reflection is used to set the value of the managed Object's field with the value of the ResultSet field with the same. name.

        Override the ObjectModel.setColumnValue() method for finer control over the way that a managed object's fields are filled from the result of a database query.

        Specified by:
        getColumnValue in class za.co.neilson.sqlite.orm.ObjectModel<T,java.sql.ResultSet,java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>>
        Parameters:
        cursor - The ResultSet returned as the result of a database query and from which an instance of the object type that this ObjectModel represents must be instantiated
        objectModelColumn - The ObjectModelColumn for which the corresponding Object Field value must be extracted from the ResultSet
        resultSetObjectModelColumnIndex - The index of this ObjectModelColumn's value in the ResultSet
        Returns:
        Object the value to set on the Object's corresponding Field from the database query ResultSet for the ObjectModelColumn parameter provided.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException
        java.lang.SecurityException
        java.sql.SQLException
        Since:
        0.1

        Parameters:
        whereClause - The optional WHERE clause to apply to the query. Passing null will select all rows
        whereArgs - Question marks in the whereClause String will be replaced with these whereArgs in order. (where id = ?)
        orderBy - a comma delimited list of the column names to order the returned results by
        Returns:
        T The first instance returned by the query
